summary: This is an email exchange between FBI and other law enforcement personnel discussing financial investigation targets related to Jeffrey Epstein. It mentions a female target who received wired money from Epstein and co-signed a property deed with him, suggesting potential use of Epstein's funds for property acquisition. The email includes standard BSA/FinCEN confidentiality warnings.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the source of wired money to a female target and as co-signer on a property deed, suggesting financial connections to associates.

connections.description: Epstein wired money to the female target and both signed as "Grantor" and "Grantee" on a property deed, indicating a financial and possibly property ownership relationship.

events.title: Email discussion of financial investigation
events.description: Law enforcement personnel exchange emails regarding financial targets connected to Jeffrey Epstein, specifically discussing a female target who received wired money from Epstein and co-signed a property deed.

keyFacts: A female target of the investigation received wired money from Jeffrey Epstein.
The same female target and Jeffrey Epstein both signed as "Grantor" and "Grantee" on a deed to a property.
The property has a Citibank mortgage, and investigators are considering subpoenaing mortgage records to determine if Epstein's money was used to fund the property.
The document contains standard Bank Secrecy Act (BSA) confidentiality warnings about the sensitive nature of financial investigation information.
The email exchange shows coordination between FBI and other law enforcement personnel on financial aspects of the Epstein investigation.
